diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Acute appendicitis with perforation and localized peritonitis, with abscess
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with RLQ abdominal pain, nausea, and vomiting. The CT scan findings showed an abnormal appendix with dilation (up to 11 mm) and indicated findings concerning for early appendicitis. The physical examination revealed tenderness in the RLQ with rebound and guarding, which reinforced the suspicion of appendicitis.
